forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 9 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 49. West wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The morning in Downtown San Francisco has a brooding grayness, a foggy veil that drapes over the city, as rain hangs in the air like a whisper. The day is likely to be damp and cool, with temperatures slowly retreating from the mid-fifties into even cooler realms as afternoon approaches. Winds blow from the west-southwest, carrying with them the scent of salt and earth, stirring the landscape lightly but unmistakably. The atmosphere feels heavy with the promise of moisture, compelling you to seek shelter or wrap yourself in layers, perhaps a soft woolen sweater beneath a raincoat, to embrace this drizzly embrace.

As the rain begins to fall more fervently in the evening, the world will take on a reflective quality—puddles forming like small mirrors, capturing fleeting moments of life against a backdrop of muted colors. For those who venture outside, consider a quiet stroll through the rain-kissed streets, where the air is fresh and alive, allowing room for contemplation and solitude. A visit to a cozy café, perhaps, would be delightful—sipping something warm as the raindrops tap gently against the window. All in all, the day invites warmth and stillness, celebrating the beauty of the city in this pleasant contrast of wet and cold.
